function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Difficulty in accurately modeling COVID-19 virus infection due to indeterminate parameters and complex transmission mechanisms.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of the number of infected people with the virus.","Mitigation":"Implement sensitivity analysis to understand the impact of different parameters and transmission mechanisms on the model's results.","Technologies":"Sensitivity analysis tools, machine learning algorithms for pattern recognition.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, building administrators.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, building administrators."},{"Description":"Inaccurate validation of the mathematical model for estimating the number of infected people due to limited consideration of infection mechanisms.","Impact":"Unreliable validation of the model's accuracy, resulting in potential misinterpretation of the results.","Mitigation":"Include multiple transmission mechanisms in the model to align with real-world infection patterns.","Technologies":"Simulation software capable of modeling various transmission mechanisms, data analysis tools for validation.","People":"Researchers, data analysts, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Systematic errors (bias) in the model's results due to inherent uncertainties and limitations in data inputs.","Impact":"Reduced reliability and accuracy of the model's predictions.","Mitigation":"Incorporate uncertainty quantification techniques and data enhancement strategies to address inherent uncertainties.","Technologies":"Uncertainty quantification software, data collection and enhancement tools.","People":"Modelers, data scientists, researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, modeling firms, data science teams."}]}
